Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: "Early Years" (1940-42), which covers the first half of his life, and "Late Years" (1942-93), which covers his later years.

I could sense that the people working behind-the-scenes really cared about their film. They may not be professionals by trade or have experience with feature-length films before (at least we can hope they'll be inspired to do so now), but there is something refreshingly joyful about their work.

"Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1978 American film "The Bad News Bears Go to Japan". A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form an alliance against the mother, son, and the cat.
